intro: Trapella antennifera, commonly known as the featherleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique foliage, with leaves that resemble feathers, gives it its common name. Trapella antennifera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care.
